title: Arrests, Deportations of Immigrants in U.S. Illegally Fell in 2021
sub_head: ICE says about 49% of immigrants arrested had criminal convictions
body:
U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement made about 74,000 arrests of immigrants in the U.S. illegally in fiscal 2021, the agency said Friday, a significant decline from previous years, as the Biden administration shifted enforcement within the U.S. to focus on those with a serious criminal record.
Of the immigrants arrested, about 49% had criminal convictions, the agency said.
